summary: A Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Avatar block type in WordPress Core allows authenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts.
details: A Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Avatar block type in WordPress Core allows authenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts.

summary: A stored cross-site scripting vulnerability in the block editor in WordPress allows authenticated users with contributor roles or above to inject malicious scripts.
details: A stored cross-site scripting vulnerability in the block editor in WordPress allows authenticated users with contributor roles or above to inject malicious scripts.

summary: A stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the block editor in WordPress Core allows authenticated attackers with contributor-level permissions to inject arbitrary web scripts.
details: A stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the block editor in WordPress Core allows authenticated attackers with contributor-level permissions to inject arbitrary web scripts.

summary: A stored cross-site scripting vulnerability in the Application Passwords screen in WordPress allows authenticated users to inject malicious scripts.
details: A stored cross-site scripting vulnerability in the Application Passwords screen in WordPress allows authenticated users to inject malicious scripts.

summary: A stored cross-site scripting vulnerability in the Footnotes block in WordPress allows authenticated users with contributor roles or above to inject malicious scripts.
details: A stored cross-site scripting vulnerability in the Footnotes block in WordPress allows authenticated users with contributor roles or above to inject malicious scripts.
